sn43.12:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, I will teach you the unconditioned and the path that leads to the unconditioned.

sn43.12:1.4.eng: The ending of greed, hate, and delusion.

sn43.12:1.6.eng: And what is the path that leads to the unconditioned?

sn43.12:1.8.eng: This is called the path that leads to the unconditioned.

sn43.12:1.9.pli: Iti kho, bhikkhave, desitaṃ vo mayā asaṅkhataṃ, desito asaṅkhatagāmimaggo.
sn43.12:1.9.eng: So, mendicants, I’ve taught you the unconditioned and the path that leads to the unconditioned.

sn43.12:1.10.pli: Yaṃ, bhikkhave, satthārā karaṇīyaṃ sāvakānaṃ hitesinā anukampakena anukampaṃ upādāya, kataṃ vo taṃ mayā.
sn43.12:1.10.eng: Out of sympathy, I’ve done what a teacher should do who wants what’s best for their disciples.

sn43.12:1.11.pli: Etāni, bhikkhave, rukkhamūlāni, etāni suññāgārāni. Jhāyatha, bhikkhave, mā pamādattha; mā pacchā vippaṭisārino ahuvattha. Ayaṃ vo amhākaṃ anusāsanīti.
sn43.12:1.11.eng: Here are these roots of trees, and here are these empty huts. Practice absorption, mendicants! Don’t be negligent! Don’t regret it later! This is my instruction to you.”

sn43.12:2.1.pli: Asaṅkhatañca vo, bhikkhave, desessāmi asaṅkhatagāmiñca maggaṃ.
sn43.12:2.1.eng: “Mendicants, I will teach you the unconditioned and the path that leads to the unconditioned.

sn43.12:2.4.eng: The ending of greed, hate, and delusion.

sn43.12:2.6.eng: And what is the path that leads to the unconditioned?

sn43.12:2.8.eng: This is called the path that leads to the unconditioned. …”

sn43.12:2.9.pli: Iti kho, bhikkhave, desitaṃ vo mayā asaṅkhataṃ …pe…

sn43.12:3.1.eng: “And what is the path that leads to the unconditioned?

sn43.12:3.2.eng: Immersion with placing the mind and keeping it connected. …

sn43.12:3.5.eng: Immersion without placing the mind, merely keeping it connected. …

sn43.12:3.8.pli: Avitakko avicāro samādhi. Ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, asaṅkhatagāmimaggo …pe….
sn43.12:3.8.eng: Immersion without placing the mind or keeping it connected. …

sn43.12:4.8.pli: Appaṇihito samādhi. Ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, asaṅkhatagāmimaggo …pe….

sn43.12:5.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu kāye kāyānupassī viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṃ.
sn43.12:5.2.eng: A mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of the body—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of covetousness and displeasure for the world. …

sn43.12:5.5.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu vedanāsu vedanānupassī viharati …pe…
sn43.12:5.5.eng: A mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of feelings …

sn43.12:5.8.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu citte cittānupassī viharati …pe…
sn43.12:5.8.eng: A mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of the mind …

sn43.12:5.11.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu dhammesu dhammānupassī viharati …pe… ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, asaṅkhatagāmimaggo …pe….
sn43.12:5.11.eng: A mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of principles …

sn43.12:6.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu anuppannānaṃ pāpakānaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ anuppādāya chandaṃ janeti vāyamati vīriyaṃ ārabhati cittaṃ paggaṇhāti padahati.
sn43.12:6.2.eng: A mendicant generates enthusiasm, tries, makes an effort, exerts the mind, and strives so that bad, unskillful qualities don’t arise. …

sn43.12:6.5.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu uppannānaṃ pāpakānaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ pahānāya chandaṃ janeti vāyamati vīriyaṃ ārabhati cittaṃ paggaṇhāti padahati.
sn43.12:6.5.eng: A mendicant generates enthusiasm, tries, makes an effort, exerts the mind, and strives so that bad, unskillful qualities are given up. …

sn43.12:6.8.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu anuppannānaṃ kusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ uppādāya chandaṃ janeti vāyamati vīriyaṃ ārabhati cittaṃ paggaṇhāti padahati.
sn43.12:6.8.eng: A mendicant generates enthusiasm, tries, makes an effort, exerts the mind, and strives so that skillful qualities arise. …

sn43.12:6.11.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu uppannānaṃ kusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ ṭhitiyā asammosāya bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya bhāvanāya pāripūriyā chandaṃ janeti vāyamati vīriyaṃ ārabhati cittaṃ paggaṇhāti padahati. Ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, asaṅkhatagāmimaggo …pe….
sn43.12:6.11.eng: A mendicant generates enthusiasm, tries, makes an effort, exerts the mind, and strives so that skillful qualities that have arisen remain, are not lost, but increase, mature, and are fulfilled by development. …

sn43.12:7.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu chandasamādhipadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgataṃ iddhipādaṃ bhāveti.
sn43.12:7.2.eng: A mendicant develops the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to enthusiasm, and active effort. …

sn43.12:7.5.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu vīriyasamādhipadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgataṃ iddhipādaṃ bhāveti.
sn43.12:7.5.eng: A mendicant develops the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to energy …

sn43.12:7.8.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu cittasamādhipadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgataṃ iddhipādaṃ bhāveti.

sn43.12:7.11.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu vīmaṃsasamādhipadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgataṃ iddhipādaṃ bhāveti. Ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, asaṅkhatagāmimaggo …pe….
sn43.12:7.11.eng: immersion due to inquiry, and active effort. …

sn43.12:8.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu saddhindriyaṃ bhāveti vivekanissitaṃ virāganissitaṃ nirodhanissitaṃ vossaggapariṇāmiṃ.
sn43.12:8.2.eng: A mendicant develops the faculty of faith, which relies on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripens as letting go. …

sn43.12:8.5.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu vīriyindriyaṃ bhāveti vivekanissitaṃ …pe…
sn43.12:8.5.eng: A mendicant develops the faculty of energy …

sn43.12:8.14.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu paññindriyaṃ bhāveti vivekanissitaṃ virāganissitaṃ nirodhanissitaṃ vossaggapariṇāmiṃ. Ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, asaṅkhatagāmimaggo …pe….
sn43.12:8.14.eng: wisdom, which relies on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripens as letting go. …

sn43.12:9.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu saddhābalaṃ bhāveti vivekanissitaṃ …pe…
sn43.12:9.2.eng: A mendicant develops the power of faith …

sn43.12:9.14.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu paññābalaṃ bhāveti vivekanissitaṃ virāganissitaṃ nirodhanissitaṃ vossaggapariṇāmiṃ. Ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, asaṅkhatagāmimaggo …pe….
sn43.12:9.14.eng: wisdom, which relies on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripens as letting go. …

sn43.12:10.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu satisambojjhaṅgaṃ bhāveti vivekanissitaṃ …pe…
sn43.12:10.2.eng: A mendicant develops the awakening factor of mindfulness …

sn43.12:10.10.pli: upekkhāsambojjhaṅgaṃ bhāveti vivekanissitaṃ virāganissitaṃ nirodhanissitaṃ vossaggapariṇāmiṃ. Ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, asaṅkhatagāmimaggo …pe….
sn43.12:10.10.eng: equanimity, which relies on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripens as letting go. …

sn43.12:11.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sammādiṭṭhiṃ bhāveti vivekanissitaṃ virāganissitaṃ nirodhanissitaṃ vossaggapariṇāmiṃ.

sn43.12:11.11.pli: asaṅkhatañca vo, bhikkhave, desessāmi asaṅkhatagāmiñca maggaṃ.

sn43.12:11.15.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sammāsamādhiṃ bhāveti vivekanissitaṃ virāganissitaṃ nirodhanissitaṃ vossaggapariṇāmiṃ.
sn43.12:11.15.eng: right immersion, which relies on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripens as letting go.

sn43.12:11.16.eng: This is called the path that leads to the unconditioned.

sn43.12:11.17.pli: Iti kho, bhikkhave, desitaṃ vo mayā asaṅkhataṃ, desito asaṅkhatagāmimaggo.
sn43.12:11.17.eng: So, mendicants, I’ve taught you the unconditioned and the path that leads to the unconditioned.

sn43.12:11.18.pli: Yaṃ, bhikkhave, satthārā karaṇīyaṃ sāvakānaṃ hitesinā anukampakena anukampaṃ upādāya, kataṃ vo taṃ mayā.
sn43.12:11.18.eng: Out of sympathy, I’ve done what a teacher should do who wants what’s best for their disciples.

sn43.12:11.19.pli: Etāni, bhikkhave, rukkhamūlāni, etāni suññāgārāni. Jhāyatha, bhikkhave, mā pamādattha; mā pacchā vippaṭisārino ahuvattha. Ayaṃ vo amhākaṃ anusāsanī”ti.
sn43.12:11.19.eng: Here are these roots of trees, and here are these empty huts. Practice absorption, mendicants! Don’t be negligent! Don’t regret it later! This is my instruction to you.”

sn43.13:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, I will teach you the uninclined …”

sn43.13:1.4.eng: (Tell in full as in the unconditioned in the previous chapter.)

sn43.14:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, I will teach you the undefiled …

sn43.15:1.1.pli: Saccañca vo, bhikkhave, desessāmi saccagāmiñca maggaṃ.

sn43.16:1.1.pli: Pārañca vo, bhikkhave, desessāmi pāragāmiñca maggaṃ.

sn43.17:1.1.pli: Nipuṇañca vo, bhikkhave, desessāmi nipuṇagāmiñca maggaṃ.

sn43.18:1.1.pli: Sududdasañca vo, bhikkhave, desessāmi sududdasagāmiñca maggaṃ.

sn43.19:1.1.pli: Ajajjarañca vo, bhikkhave, desessāmi ajajjaragāmiñca maggaṃ.

sn43.20:1.1.pli: Dhuvañca vo, bhikkhave, desessāmi dhuvagāmiñca maggaṃ.

sn43.21:1.1.pli: Apalokitañca vo, bhikkhave, desessāmi apalokitagāmiñca maggaṃ.

sn43.22:1.1.pli: Anidassanañca vo, bhikkhave, desessāmi anidassanagāmiñca maggaṃ.

sn43.23:1.1.pli: Nippapañcañca vo, bhikkhave, desessāmi nippapañcagāmiñca maggaṃ.

sn43.24:1.1.pli: Santañca vo, bhikkhave, desessāmi santagāmiñca maggaṃ.

sn43.25:1.1.pli: Amatañca vo, bhikkhave, desessāmi amatagāmiñca maggaṃ.

sn43.26:1.1.pli: Paṇītañca vo, bhikkhave, desessāmi paṇītagāmiñca maggaṃ.

sn43.27:1.1.pli: Sivañca vo, bhikkhave, desessāmi sivagāmiñca maggaṃ.

sn43.28:1.1.pli: Khemañca vo, bhikkhave, desessāmi khemagāmiñca maggaṃ.

sn43.29:1.1.pli: Taṇhākkhayañca vo, bhikkhave, desessāmi taṇhākkhayagāmiñca maggaṃ.

sn43.30:1.1.pli: Acchariyañca vo, bhikkhave, desessāmi acchariyagāmiñca maggaṃ.

sn43.31:1.1.pli: Abbhutañca vo, bhikkhave, desessāmi abbhutagāmiñca maggaṃ.

sn43.32:1.1.pli: Anītikañca vo, bhikkhave, desessāmi anītikagāmiñca maggaṃ.

sn43.33:1.1.pli: Anītikadhammañca vo, bhikkhave, desessāmi anītikadhammagāmiñca maggaṃ.

sn43.34:1.1.pli: Nibbānañca vo, bhikkhave, desessāmi nibbānagāmiñca maggaṃ.

sn43.35:1.1.pli: Abyābajjhañca vo, bhikkhave, desessāmi abyābajjhagāmiñca maggaṃ.

sn43.36:1.1.pli: Virāgañca vo, bhikkhave, desessāmi virāgagāmiñca maggaṃ.

sn43.37:1.1.pli: Suddhiñca vo, bhikkhave, desessāmi suddhigāmiñca maggaṃ.

sn43.37:1.2.pli: Taṃ suṇātha. Katamā ca, bhikkhave, suddhi …pe….

sn43.38:1.1.pli: Muttiñca vo, bhikkhave, desessāmi muttigāmiñca maggaṃ.

sn43.38:1.2.pli: Taṃ suṇātha. Katamā ca, bhikkhave, mutti …pe….

sn43.39:1.1.pli: Anālayañca vo, bhikkhave, desessāmi anālayagāmiñca maggaṃ.

sn43.39:1.2.pli: Taṃ suṇātha. Katamo ca, bhikkhave, anālayo …pe….

sn43.40:1.1.pli: Dīpañca vo, bhikkhave, desessāmi dīpagāmiñca maggaṃ.

sn43.41:1.1.pli: Leṇañca vo, bhikkhave, desessāmi leṇagāmiñca maggaṃ.

sn43.42:1.1.pli: Tāṇañca vo, bhikkhave, desessāmi tāṇagāmiñca maggaṃ.

sn43.43:1.1.pli: Saraṇañca vo, bhikkhave, desessāmi saraṇagāmiñca maggaṃ.

sn43.2:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, I will teach you the unconditioned and the path that leads to the unconditioned.

sn43.2:1.4.eng: The ending of greed, hate, and delusion.

sn43.2:1.6.eng: And what is the path that leads to the unconditioned?

sn43.2:1.8.eng: This is called the path that leads to the unconditioned. …”

sn43.3:0.3.eng: Placing the Mind and Keeping it Connected

sn43.3:1.1.eng: “And what is the path that leads to the unconditioned?

sn43.3:1.2.pli: Savitakkasavicāro samādhi, avitakkavicāramatto samādhi, avitakkaavicāro samādhi—ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, asaṅkhatagāmimaggo …pe….
sn43.3:1.2.eng: Immersion with placing the mind and keeping it connected. Immersion without placing the mind, merely keeping it connected. Immersion without placing the mind or keeping it connected. …”

sn43.4:1.1.eng: “And what is the path that leads to the unconditioned?

sn43.4:1.2.pli: Suññato samādhi, animitto samādhi, appaṇihito samādhi—ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, asaṅkhatagāmimaggo …pe….
sn43.4:1.2.eng: Emptiness immersion; signless immersion; undirected immersion. …”

sn43.44:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, I will teach you the haven and the path that leads to the haven.

sn43.44:1.4.eng: The ending of greed, hate, and delusion.

sn43.44:1.6.eng: And what is the path that leads to the haven?

sn43.44:1.8.eng: This is called the path that leads to the haven.

sn43.44:1.9.pli: Iti kho, bhikkhave, desitaṃ vo mayā parāyanaṃ, desito parāyanagāmimaggo.
sn43.44:1.9.eng: So, mendicants, I’ve taught you the haven and the path that leads to the haven.

sn43.44:1.10.pli: Yaṃ, bhikkhave, satthārā karaṇīyaṃ sāvakānaṃ hitesinā anukampakena anukampaṃ upādāya, kataṃ vo taṃ mayā.
sn43.44:1.10.eng: Out of sympathy, I’ve done what a teacher should do who wants what’s best for their disciples.

sn43.44:1.11.pli: Etāni, bhikkhave, rukkhamūlāni, etāni suññāgārāni. Jhāyatha, bhikkhave, mā pamādattha; mā pacchā vippaṭisārino ahuvattha. Ayaṃ vo amhākaṃ anusāsanī”ti.
sn43.44:1.11.eng: Here are these roots of trees, and here are these empty huts. Practice absorption, mendicants! Don’t be negligent! Don’t regret it later! This is my instruction to you.”

sn43.44:1.12.eng: (Tell in full as in the unconditioned.)

sn43.44:4.5.eng: The Linked Discourses on the unconditioned are complete.

sn43.5:1.1.eng: “And what is the path that leads to the unconditioned?

sn43.5:1.2.pli: Cattāro satipaṭṭhānā. Ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, asaṅkhatagāmimaggo …pe….
sn43.5:1.2.eng: The four kinds of mindfulness meditation. …”

sn43.6:1.1.eng: “And what is the path that leads to the unconditioned?

sn43.6:1.2.pli: Cattāro sammappadhānā. Ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, asaṅkhatagāmimaggo …pe….

sn43.7:1.1.eng: “And what is the path that leads to the unconditioned?

sn43.7:1.2.pli: Cattāro iddhipādā. Ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, asaṅkhatagāmimaggo …pe….
sn43.7:1.2.eng: The four bases of psychic power. …”

sn43.8:1.1.eng: “And what is the path that leads to the unconditioned?

sn43.9:1.1.eng: “And what is the path that leads to the unconditioned?

sn43.9:1.2.pli: Pañca balāni. Ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, asaṅkhatagāmimaggo …pe….
